testcase.name: runScenario["Successful registration with a valid password", "MoneyGaming Registration"](1)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Successful registration with a valid password # src/test/resources/features/MIHAELA_YORDANOVA_MG.feature:7 Navigating to the registration page... Given I am on the registration page # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_am_on_the_registration_page() Entering password: Secure@123 When I enter a valid password "Secure@123" # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_enter_a_valid_password(java.lang.String) Submitting registration form... And I submit the registration form # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_submit_the_registration_form() Verifying confirmation message... Then I should see a confirmation message # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_should_see_a_confirmation_message()

testcase.name: runScenario["Password too short", "MoneyGaming Registration"](2)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Password too short # src/test/resources/features/MIHAELA_YORDANOVA_MG.feature:13 Navigating to the registration page... Given I am on the registration page # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_am_on_the_registration_page() Entering short password: A@1 When I enter a password "A@1" that is less than 6 characters # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_enter_a_password_that_is_less_than_characters(java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer) Submitting registration form... And I submit the registration form # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_submit_the_registration_form() Checking for error message: Password must be at least 6 characters long Then I should see an error message "Password must be at least 6 characters long" # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_should_see_an_error_message(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: runScenario["Password missing a number", "MoneyGaming Registration"](3)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Password missing a number # src/test/resources/features/MIHAELA_YORDANOVA_MG.feature:19 Navigating to the registration page... Given I am on the registration page # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_am_on_the_registration_page() Entering password without a number: Secure@! When I enter a password "Secure@!" without a number # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_enter_a_password_without_a_number(java.lang.String) Submitting registration form... And I submit the registration form # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_submit_the_registration_form() Checking for error message: Password must contain at least one number Then I should see an error message "Password must contain at least one number" # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_should_see_an_error_message(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: runScenario["Password missing a special character", "MoneyGaming Registration"](4)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Password missing a special character # src/test/resources/features/MIHAELA_YORDANOVA_MG.feature:25 Navigating to the registration page... Given I am on the registration page # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_am_on_the_registration_page() Entering password without a special character: Secure123 When I enter a password "Secure123" without a special character # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_enter_a_password_without_a_special_character(java.lang.String) Submitting registration form... And I submit the registration form # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_submit_the_registration_form() Checking for error message: Password must contain at least one special character Then I should see an error message "Password must contain at least one special character" # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_should_see_an_error_message(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: runScenario["Password missing both a number and a special character", "MoneyGaming Registration"](5)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Password missing both a number and a special character # src/test/resources/features/MIHAELA_YORDANOVA_MG.feature:31 Navigating to the registration page... Given I am on the registration page # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_am_on_the_registration_page() Entering password without number and special character: SecurePass When I enter a password "SecurePass" without a number and special character # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_enter_a_password_without_a_number_and_special_character(java.lang.String) Submitting registration form... And I submit the registration form # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_submit_the_registration_form() Checking for error message: Password must contain at least one number and one special character Then I should see an error message "Password must contain at least one number and one special character" # stepdefinitions.RegistrationSteps.i_should_see_an_error_message(java.lang.String)
